summary: Key findings for BOJ rate hike question - current rate 0.75%, January held, next hike expected July by consensus but hawkish signals
content:
## Key Facts
- BOJ raised rate to 0.75% in December 2025 (from 0.5%)
- January 22-23, 2026: Held at 0.75% (8-1 vote). Takata dissented, wanted 1%.
- Ueda: real rates "extremely low", ready to continue hiking if conditions align
- BOJ upgraded GDP forecasts, retained hawkish inflation forecasts
- "Some in BOJ see scope to raise rates sooner than markets expect" (Jan 16)

## Analyst Views
- Reuters poll (Jan 2026): Median expects July for next hike
- >75% of analysts expect 1%+ by September
- "Rates market started to price in higher chance of April rate hike"
- Citigroup: April hike if yen goes past 160
- ING: October most likely (bearish view)
- State Street: base case one hike in 2026

## Political Factor
- Snap election Feb 8, 2026. LDP (Takaichi) appears within reach of majority
- Takaichi favors loose monetary policy, advocates for government control over monetary direction
- But BOJ has formal independence and hiked in December despite Takaichi pressure

## Wage Negotiations
- Spring wage talks (shunto) began Jan 27
- Target 5%+ for third year
- Results expected by mid-March
- BOJ closely monitoring - key factor for policy decisions

## Meeting Schedule (estimated)
- January 22-23 (done, held)
- March ~12-13 (in window)
- April 30-May 1 (borderline - 2025 pattern was April 30-May 1, but 2024 was April 25-26)
- The resolution says "before May 1, 2026" - if announcement on May 1, doesn't qualify
